instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.LCD_PWR_EN: What is LCD_PWR_EN? LCD_PWR_EN is a signal that tells the chip that supplies power to the LCD screen to turn on..
definitions.LVDS_DDC_CLK: What is LVDS_DDC_CLK? LVDS_DDC_CLK Is the DDC clock line between the graphics processor and the screen. DDC is a protocol for identifying a screen so that you know what resolution/refresh rate it wants. This is necessary for screen detection, inductor on this data line must be good and DDC voltage must be going to the LCD screen for it to work. .
definitions.LVDS_DDC_DATA: What is LVDS_DDC_DATA? LVDS_DDC_DATA Is the DDC data line between the graphics processor and the screen. DDC is a protocol for identifying a screen so that you know what resolution/refresh rate it wants. This is necessary for screen detection, inductor on this data line must be good and DDC voltage must be going to the LCD screen for it to work. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is missing
threads.message:
Hello,
Would any one be so kind to help with this issue that i'm facing, please.
A logicboard <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> has green light on the charger and it turns on but there is no video.
I measured <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> and <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> on pin 1 is missing. pin 2 and 3 have 3,42.
pin 4 5 and 6 are 0.
(Sorry for my bad English)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is missing
threads.message:
Check first for USB activity; no reason to search video on a non-working board...

Post voltage for L7510/20.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is missing
threads.message:
Thanks for your replay
the voltage on L7510 is 0.84v and L7520 is 0.83 and L7550 is 0.34
and the usb muse turns on

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is missing
threads.message:
So the board boots.
Check voltage on J9000, pins 4, 6, 7.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is missing
threads.message:
all of them 4, 6 and 7 have 3,39v
(cable is not connected)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is missing
threads.message:
You need to connect LCD when measure J9000.
Check if L9004/08/80 are all OK.

Next, check resistance to ground on all LVDS_IG_A_DATA_ lines.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is missing
threads.message:
The L9004, L9008, L9080 are all ok.
and the resistance to ground on pin 8,9,11,12,14, 15 and 17 are between 1.2 and 2 ohms

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is missing
threads.message:
???
Did you measure diode mode on powered board???
Please, measure in correct way...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is missing
threads.message:
Dear sir,
I measured them again on powered board with connected cable,
all of these pins 8,9,11,12,14, 15 and 17 are 1.01 in diode mode

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is missing
threads.message: and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_LCDVDD_SW</SIGNAL> on diode mode shows 0.071

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is missing
threads.message: Never-ever measure diode mode on powered board!!!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is missing
threads.message:
Dear I did the measurement again.
pin 8,9,11,12,14,15,17 are 0.64 in diode mode

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is missing
threads.message: Try known good LCD assembly (screen + video cable).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is missing
threads.message: with LCD assembly all the pins 8,9,11,12,14,15,17 are 0.42.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is missing
threads.message:
"Try known good LCD assembly (screen + video cable)."
Means check if get image and backlight...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is missing
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0_LCD_F</SIGNAL>  on pin 4 is 3.4
<SIGNAL>LVDS_DDC_CLK</SIGNAL> on pin 6 is 3.4
<SIGNAL>LVDS_DDC_DATA</SIGNAL> on pin 7 is 3,4
on backlight fuse i have 12,4
<SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is missing

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is missing
threads.message: Sorry accidentally post it 3 times

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is missing
threads.message:
Did you measure with known good LCD connected?
Do you get image and only missing backlight?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is missing
threads.message:
yes I measured with known good LCD connected.
and on <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> pin one <SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is missing but pin 2 and 3 are ok.
and on the LCD connector pin 2 and 3 <SIGNAL>PP3V3_LCDVDD_SW_F</SIGNAL> is missing
pin 6 <SIGNAL>LVDS_DDC_CLK</SIGNAL> is 3.4
pin 7 <SIGNAL>LVDS_DDC_DATA</SIGNAL> is 3,4

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is missing
threads.message:
Seems that LCD is not detected.
Do you surelly have USB activity?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is missing
threads.message:
Yes Sir when i plug a usb mouse the red light turns on ( I tried with different mouses ). And also on L7510 and L7520 I get 0.88v but on L7550 I gent 0.35v.
(The L7550 is <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_AXG_R</SIGNAL>)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is missing
threads.message: I've replace the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> with a new one( not from a downer board)  because be for L7520 and L7510 had 0v.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is missing
threads.message:
What relation you've seen between <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and L7510/20???

"L7510 and L7520 I get 0.88v but on L7550 I gent 0.35v
--------------
for L7520 and L7510 had 0v"
What this mean???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is missing
threads.message: be for i didn't have cpuvcore because of the <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> I decided to replace <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7510</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7520</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7550</TRANSISTOR> after replacing them I get 0.8 on L7510,20 and 0.3 on L7550

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is missing
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>CPU_VCC_VALSENS_N</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>CPU_AXG_VALSENS_N</SIGNAL> are missing but

<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> is ok and <SIGNAL>CPU_VALSENS_P</SIGNAL> is also ok
